lines.text: What am I, a fucking retard, man? Am I A FUCKING RETARD, HUH? I know what this is! Lou's trying to snuff me out because of his GREASY LITTLE NEPHEW being around! WELL, VIVE LA FUCKING FRANCE, MAN!
Fuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuck!
Hi-fucking-YA!

[growls]
Someone's gonna kill me man!
Who would try to kill you, Eddie?
The fucking hangers!

[holding a knife to the throat of a man who just tried to kill him]
OK baby girl! Who sent ya? Who sent ya?
[first lines]

Most people like to think they have some degree of control over their lives. The truth is we're subject to the influence of others. Those who appreciate this can make a lot of money from those who don't. But any small-time grifter who ever dealt off the bottom of a deck can tell you that. What I can tell you about is the price one pays for peddling confidence. How every mark you fleece takes away a piece of your soul, and what happens when you try to pick up the pieces.
There's more to life than just passing the time, isn't there, Diane?
Maybe we're just both running around in circles, and just happen to touch. The sun and the moon do that. They call it an eclipse.
[last lines]

Most people never feel the strings that gently tug them day-in and day-out. Mine had been jerked every which way before I cut 'em loose and left the tangled mess going round in circles with my pop and all that cash I wanted no part of. It was a colorful world I was walking away from, but nothing in it was real. Not my pop, not the bastards who'd help dupe me. Not Diane who almost broke my heart. All I took from them were memories - images really. They're worth more than any take from any con. They keep me honest.
You filthy, double crossing, little fucking filthy, double crossing, filthy, fucking goddamn fucking filthy little RAT!
How's your pool game?
Not so good.
Ah, perfect. Perfect.
If there were a fat lady in here I thing she'd be clearing her throat - right - about - now.
[takes his final billiard shot]
Deep. Flawless.
Yep, five carats.
Did you know that in many lands it is believed that a spirit lives inside the diamond. That is why it has such... sparkle.
There're a lot more spirits where that one came from.
Power. God. They all have a distinct
[sniffs money]
aroma. But none as sweet as death.
When thing's fall apart is when people stagger to whatever is familiar. Same way a bull charges a red cape after being stabbed a dozen times or so.

[to Joe Donan]
Tell you what, if it's a high card, I'll tell you who I am. But if it's a low card, I'll tell you who you are. Is that a deal?
